para.text: There is established within the Department of Employment Services the Incarceration to Incorporation Entrepreneurship Program, a business development program for returning citizens, which shall be operated by DOES, in conjunction with the Department of Small and Local Business Development, to:
Invest in for-profit and nonprofit businesses owned, operated, or managed by returning citizens;
Provide a program to assist a returning citizen in obtaining a general education development diploma;
Provide classes to improve math, reading, and writing abilities; (4) Provide business and microenterprise development training to include:
Accounting;
Finance;
Administration;
Business planning;
Budgeting;
Marketing;
Business law;
Accessing startup capital, and other business startup topics as identified by the U.S. Small Business Administration and Certified Community Development Financial Institutions;

Training and guidance on the certification process for becoming a certified business enterprise pursuant to the Small and Certified Business Enterprise Development and Assistance Act of 2005, effective October 20, 2005 (D.C. Law 16-33; D.C. Official Code § 2-1801.01 et seq.); and
Technology training;
Provide educational workshops and seminars on financial literacy;
Provide ongoing mentorship and support;
Place participants in apprenticeships at established businesses;
Provide monthly networking meetings with business leaders, such as:
Business owners;
Angel investors; and
Heads of venture capital and investment firms; and
Provide scholarships or grants for returning citizens to enroll in business classes at the University of the District of Columbia or the University of the District of Columbia Community College.
DOES shall confer with other agencies, organizations, and individuals such as:
The Office of the Deputy Mayor for Greater Economic Opportunity;
The Workforce Investment Council;
The Mayor's Office on Returning Citizen Affairs; and
Any other relevant agency or organization that DOES and DSLBD consider necessary to meet the objectives of this act.
For the purposes of this section, the term "returning citizen" means a resident who was previously incarcerated.
